description.zh-cn: 位于日本近畿地方的都市，自794年至1869年为日本首都。其历史始于平安京，是日本中古及近世重要的政治与文化中心。
description.en: A city in the Kinki region of Japan, which served as the capital of Japan from 794 to 1869. Its history began as Heian-kyō, and it was a major political and cultural center in medieval and early modern Japan.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的岛屿国家。
description.en: An island country in East Asia.

description.zh-cn: 日本第50代天皇，将首都从长冈京迁至平安京（京都）。
description.en: The 50th emperor of Japan, who moved the capital from Nagaoka-kyō to Heian-kyō (Kyoto).

description.zh-cn: 中国唐代的都城之一，其布局是平安京（京都）的仿照对象。
description.en: One of the capitals of the Tang Dynasty in China, whose layout was a model for Heian-kyō (Kyoto).

description.zh-cn: 中国唐代的都城之一，其布局是平安京（京都）的仿照对象。平安京的东半部亦被称为“洛阳”，并成为京都的代名词。
description.en: One of the capitals of the Tang Dynasty in China, whose layout was a model for Heian-kyō (Kyoto). The eastern half of Heian-kyō was also called 'Luoyang', which became a synonym for Kyoto.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上的一个武家政权。因其设在京都，使得京都的政治色彩一度复苏。
description.en: A feudal military government in the history of Japan. Because it was based in Kyoto, the city's political character was revived.

description.zh-cn: 一场开启了日本战国时代的内战，期间京都几乎被完全烧毁。
description.en: A civil war that initiated the Sengoku period in Japan, during which Kyoto was almost completely destroyed by fire.

description.zh-cn: 日本历史上的一个时期，始于应仁之乱。
description.en: A period in Japanese history that began with the Ōnin War.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代的大名，曾保护并支持京都的复兴。
description.en: A daimyō of the Sengoku period in Japan who protected and supported the revival of Kyoto.

description.zh-cn: 日本战国时代的政治家，继织田信长后统一日本。他曾保护并支持京都的复兴，并对城市进行了大规模改造。
description.en: A politician of the Sengoku period who unified Japan after Oda Nobunaga. He protected and supported the revival of Kyoto and carried out large-scale renovations of the city.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪日本的一系列政治和社会改革事件，期间设立了京都府，并将首都迁至东京。
description.en: A series of political and social reform events in 19th-century Japan, during which Kyoto Prefecture was established and the capital was moved to Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 日本的现任首都。17世纪后成为日本的政治中心，并于1869年正式取代京都成为首都。
description.en: The current capital of Japan. It became the political center of Japan after the 17th century and officially replaced Kyoto as the capital in 1869.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一个地方行政区，于明治维新后设立，管辖京都市。
description.en: A local administrative division of Japan, established after the Meiji Restoration, which has jurisdiction over Kyoto City.

description.zh-cn: 日本京都府管辖下的现代城市，于1889年由上京区和下京区合并而成。
description.en: The modern city under the jurisdiction of Kyoto Prefecture, Japan, formed in 1889 by the merger of Kamigyō-ku and Shimogyō-ku.

description.zh-cn: 京都（平安京）于794年被定为日本首都，直到1869年迁都东京为止。
description.en: Kyoto (Heian-kyō) was established as the capital of Japan in 794 and remained so until the capital was moved to Tokyo in 1869.

description.zh-cn: 平安京（京都）在建设时仿照了中国唐代西京长安城的布局。
description.en: The city of Heian-kyō (Kyoto) was laid out modeled on the capital of Tang China, Chang'an.

description.zh-cn: 平安京（京都）在建设时仿照了中国唐代东都洛阳城的布局。后来，平安京的东半部（左京）因繁荣发展而被称为“洛阳”，并成为京都的代名词。
description.en: The city of Heian-kyō (Kyoto) was laid out modeled on the eastern capital of Tang China, Luoyang. Later, the prosperous eastern half of the city (Sakyō) became known as 'Luoyang', which became a synonym for Kyoto.

description.zh-cn: 桓武天皇时期，日本首都从长冈京迁至平安京，开启了京都作为都城的发展历史。
description.en: During the reign of Emperor Kanmu, the capital of Japan was moved from Nagaoka-kyō to Heian-kyō, initiating Kyoto's development as the capital city.

description.zh-cn: 室町幕府位于京都，使其政治色彩再度复苏。
description.en: The Muromachi shogunate was located in Kyoto, which revived the city's political significance.

description.zh-cn: 在应仁之乱中，京都几乎被完全烧毁，导致城市一度衰落。
description.en: During the Ōnin War, Kyoto was almost completely burned down, leading to the city's temporary decline.

description.zh-cn: 应仁之乱的爆发开启了日本的战国时代。
description.en: The outbreak of the Ōnin War marked the beginning of the Sengoku period in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 在应仁之乱后，织田信长保护并支持了京都的复兴。
description.en: After the Ōnin War, Oda Nobunaga protected and supported the revival of Kyoto.

description.zh-cn: 在应仁之乱后，丰臣秀吉保护并支持了京都的复兴，并对城市进行了大规模改造。
description.en: After the Ōnin War, Toyotomi Hideyoshi protected and supported the revival of Kyoto, and carried out large-scale renovations of the city.

description.zh-cn: 作为明治维新的一部分，日本首都于1869年由京都迁往东京，结束了京都作为首都的地位。
description.en: As part of the Meiji Restoration, the capital of Japan was moved from Kyoto to Tokyo in 1869, ending Kyoto's status as the capital.

description.zh-cn: 作为明治维新的一部分，日本首都于1869年由京都迁往东京，使其成为日本新的政治中心。
description.en: As part of the Meiji Restoration, the capital of Japan was moved from Kyoto to Tokyo in 1869, making it the new political center of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 明治维新以后，日本政府设立了京都府作为地方行政区。
description.en: After the Meiji Restoration, the Japanese government established Kyoto Prefecture as a local administrative division.

description.zh-cn: 京都市是京都府管辖下的城市。
description.en: Kyoto City is a city under the jurisdiction of Kyoto Prefecture.
